title: RailPart​
content: </> type RailPart = BasePart &{ Prev: Attachment , Next: Attachment } A part with two child attachments Prev and Next. Typically, the Next attachment of one part has the same position as the Prev attachment of another part.

title: Enabled​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RailGrinder.Enabled: boolean Describes whether this RailGrinder is currently enabled. Please use RailGrinder:Enable and RailGrinder:Disable to update this value.

title: CurrentPart​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RailGrinder.CurrentPart: RailPart The part currently being grinded on.

title: Speed​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RailGrinder.Speed: number Describes how fast the position changes every update. Please useRailGrinder:SetSpeed to change this value.

title: Position​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RailGrinder.Position: Vector3  The current position as calculated by RailGrinder.Update.

title: Velocity​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RailGrinder.Velocity: Vector3  Describes how fast the position changes every update, represented as a Vector3 with a magnitude and direction. This exists for the end-user, and only updates when RailGrinder.CurrentPart or RailGrinder.Speed changes.

title: Completed​
content: Events </> RailGrinder.Completed: RBXScriptSignal <> Fires when this RailGrinder has finished or is disabled.

title: PositionChanged​
content: Events </> RailGrinder.PositionChanged: RBXScriptSignal <Vector3 > Fires when RailGrinder.Position is updated.

title: PartChanged​
content: Events </> RailGrinder.PartChanged: RBXScriptSignal <RailPart> Fires when RailGrinder.CurrentPart is updated.

title: new​
content: Static </> RailGrinder.new() → () Creates a new RailGrinder instance, which lets one "vessel" grind one rail.

title: GetNextPart​
content: </> RailGrinder.GetNextPart( direction: -1 | 1-- Which direction the next part should come from. ) → RailPart?-- The next part to grind on. This callback is used to get the next part when the new position is beyond the extents of the current part. Back end means direction = -1. Front end means direction = 1. Returning nil disables the instance.

title: Enable​
content: </> RailGrinder:Enable( currentPart: BasePart ,-- The instance the vessel is grinding on. vessel: BasePart? -- The instance grinding the rail. ) → () Sets all properties required to start grinding the rail and starts updating them and firing events using a connection to RunService.Heartbeat. The vessel argument is only used to calculate the speed and position relative to currentPart, so it is optional.

title: Disable​
content: </> RailGrinder:Disable() → () Stops updating variables and firing events.

title: Update​
content: </> RailGrinder:Update( deltaTime: number-- The amount of time that passed since last update. ) → () A function that runs every RunService.Heartbeat, this fires the RailGrinder.PositionChanged event after every update, fires RailGrinder.Completed once finished, and calls RailGrinder.GetNextPart when it needs new parts.

title: SetSpeed​
content: </> RailGrinder:SetSpeed( newSpeed: number-- The new speed the RailGrinder should update at ) → () Sets how fast the position should change
